ngoList.title: Shruti Creations
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The major activities of the unit are to produce original plays written by eminent Indian playwrights and/or adaptation of foreign writers in any language of the world. We belive, group theatre is serving the society through its play productions. Our main purpose is to educate people through amusement. Our aim and object is to make people aware of the economic deprivation, their rights and also to educate the masses through our play productions. Keeping in view the above we have so far produced a few plays of Rabindranath Tagore and plays written by Shri Mohit Chattopadhyay, an eminent playwright and thinker of our time. We have successfully produced â€˜Ringâ€™ and â€˜Saral Ankaâ€™ by Shri Mohit Chattopadhyay. The productions have been highly acclaimed by the audience, critics and elites of the society. The renowned educationist and play critic, Shri Dipendu Chakraborty has specially discussed about the above mentioned productions and highly praised the content and presentation of the productions in his critical analysis in Desh Patrika. It is our intention and endeavor to find out the form, which is indigenous and Indian for that we are working to explore the possibilities of our folk art of different regions. We are also working with un-privileged classes to have an understanding about their wants, means of living etc. since our country consists mainly of the people of rural India. We would like to include in our productions their lives and livelihood. Since our above work needs extensive field work we will also institute spot improvisation on different locales. We have just mentioned in brief our activities and achievements for your kind information and consideration.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: SHYAMBAZAR BLIND OPERA, KOLKATA - a group theatre organization of the predominantly VISUALLY CHALLENGED YOUTH - is trying earnestly to evolve a theatre with and for this neglected and peripheral segment of the society. We believe that this â€˜wretched of the earthâ€™ can genuinely give a trial to their life if there begins a process of self awareness, reasoning and imaginative perception on the world around, along with creative participation in an environment of togetherness. And this has been partly realized. Opera is participating in social activities with its theatre productions. Whether the occasion being an EYE CAMP or a LEPROSY HOSPITAL or for SPREADING BRAILLE EDUCATION. Opera has successfully organized Workshop of the Visually Challenged Youth in collaboration with the Dept.of Sc. & Tech. & NES, Govt. of West Bengal, to explore the possibility of using theatre to impart mobility to them. Workshop with the marginally â€˜Orthopaedically Challengedâ€™ youth was arranged to trained them as â€˜back stageâ€™artists in theatre& TVs to rehabilitate them in collaboration with â€˜Roopkala Kendroâ€™, a Govt. of West Bengal enterprise. Moreover, we have conducted workshops in different institutions on â€˜Strengthening Education in Human Valuesâ€™ for the Visually Impaired, a project with the financial support of Department of Secondary Education & Higher Education, Ministry of Human Resource Development. Members are gaining confidence. Blind actors - Sri Shamim Akhtar, Sri Samir Ghosal and Sm Sutapa Samanta - have directed a play on Environment & Echology with the students of â€˜Jana Mangal Adarsha Andha Vidyalayaâ€™of Dibrugarh, Assam in the month of July-August of the last year. It was a outstanding production, so far the report goes. Members are now more mobile and able to communicate the seeing world and dare to dream of a decent livelihood from self employment. Uptill now Opera has presented fourteen theatre productions: Orchestra (2hrs, 1996-97), Sankranti (1hr, 1997-98), Andhakaarer Rupkatha (1hr 40m, 1998-99), Manasa Mangal (2hr 20m, 1999- 2000), Chaitanyer Mrityu (2hr, 2000-01), Nissanga Vidyasagar (2hrs, 2001-02), Raja (1hr40m, 2002-03) Aatarbalaar Simantagatha (2hrs, 2003-04) , Thake Sudhu Nachiketa (2hrs, 2004-05) , Tagoreâ€™s Raktakarabi (1hr 40m, 2005-06), Banijya Bistar (1hr 35m, 2006-07) & Brist Bristi (1hr 50m, 2007-08), Brihannala (1hr,2008-09) & Kamala Sagar (1hr15mins,2008-09) Opera is also trying to include this theatre in the academic syllabus of the visually challenged students in their schools. Because it is now established that through theatre students can acquire and restore their mobility , at least partly and can gain confidence to take part in all the dialogues with the world around. The mobility workshop in the Institute for the Blind are now being carried out mainly by the Visually Impaired actors & actresses with the assistances from the sighted members.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Shyambazar Anyadesh is the only theatre group working with the sightless artists in the country at present. We have conducted theatre workshops with physically challenged as well as marginal youth and children in many districts of West Bengal in order to develop their physical and intellectual development by applying the principles of drama therapy. We have produced the following plays: (1) Jakhan Andha Prakriti Chandalika, (2) Raktakarabi, (3) Banglar Brata (these 3 plays are based on works of Tagore), (4) Eodipus At Colonus, (5) Kaliyodaman, (6) Jananir Desh (the last 2 plays are directed by Sri Subhash Dey, the first and foremost vissually challenged director in the country). besides that we are engaged in publishing theatre magazines etc.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: In order to fulfill the purpose of social work of the institution, we first started work in the field of education. We have been running a school called Kritivas Model School since 2016-17. We choose english as the medium of education as our region is far behind in English education as compared to the surrounding cities. Other private English medium school ask for much higher monthly fees and grants. In comparison, we are giving quality education with very low fees without any donation.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: To start english medium school named "KRITIVAS MODEL SCHOOL". Fund collected through member subscription fee and donation. We start the school with the available funds and resources.
To run school we have collected the subscription fee of members, tuition fee of students (minimum) and donation from members.
No Private and government institution provide any fund. we are running the school with own minimum resources and funds.
we did not get any grants from government body neither we received any donation from private organisation. All expenses done from fee and member subscription, donation.

ngoList.title: Song of Soul

isuues.name: Key Issues
isuues.value: Art & Culture,Rural Development & Poverty Alleviation,Tribal Affairs

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Song of Soul is attempting to document and record the inside story of folk and tribal music of India, a major part of which still lies undiscovered.The way the new generation of rural and tribal people is loosing interest in keeping their traditional forms alive,the time has come to support them through serious collaborative exchanges,workshops,and shows that can help them to earn and to look at this art form as a promising yet profitable venture,thus making an effort to save this rich variety of musical expressions from becoming extinct.Song of Soul is focussing on folk and tribal dance, drama, music, instruments and related matters, including the extent to which these cultures retain the rituals, beliefs and identity of their ancestors, and how modern technology has impacted their value systems and heritage. In the past 4 months through different projects the number of folk musician beneficiaries have exceeded more than 400.
